column4: is it normal to see a bunch of SQUASHFS error while loading the ubuntu setup?
oh, i'm guessing it's not, because it just took me to a terminal..
heh.
not normal. My first guess is a dirty CD...
bad dvd reader?
google the exact model + install problems. 9.04 I presume?
run md5sum on the cd?
exact model of the dell? Version of the OS you're installing?
dell demension e310, newest ubuntu available on the site
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-125417.html ?
my errors are different
run md5sum on the cd?
just stop bellyaching and run md5sum
:-). Actually, I wanted to verify the burn, but I realise if you can't run the livecd, it can't be done.
that would verify the disk, which is good, but I really wanted to verify the entire hardware chain i.e. disk, controller, dvd reader etc. which you can't do, right?
at this point, I'd download something else e.g. DSL and see if that boots. If it does, you'll know there's something weird about Ubuntu. If not, you definitely have a harware problem...
actually, systemrescue might be ideal: http://www.sysresccd.org/Main_Page
sorry?

you can do all sorts with system rescue, including partitioning, fscking disks etc. But I basically want to verify if your hardware can boot *any* kind of linux successfully. since you've obviously drawn a complete blank with Ubuntu twice over now...
decided what to do next?
i gotta get some sleep actually i'll try that stuff tomorrow
ok, best of luck...
